items.title: Childcare company's bid to more than double in size alarms safety experts
items.description: Embark Education launches a takeover bid for rival early childcare company Mayfield Education, alarming experts who say providers that fail to meet baseline safety standards are being allowed to expand without oversight.

items.title: Sydney's grieving Jewish community joined by thousands to mark one week since Bondi massacre
items.description: Emotional scenes and a heavy police presence are visible at Bondi Beach as the Jewish community and other locals mark one week since the Hanukkah shooting.

items.title: Long-awaited mandatory wine code of conduct arrives too late for growers
items.description: After 20 years, three senate inquiries and an independent review, the sale of wine grapes will be regulated by a mandatory code of conduct, but growers say it might be too late.

items.title: Bazball finally admits its failings, albeit far too late
items.description: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

items.title: Doctors turn Ozempic patients away from surgery due to extra risks
items.description: Doctors say they are forced to delay some procedures due to the risk of serious consequences for patients on Ozempic-like drugs.

items.title: Gun dealers warn new gun law reform threatens livelihoods
items.description: Straight-pull rapid-fire rifles, social media campaigns, and a looming buyback scheme – Australia's gun debate is reloading.

items.title: What we know about the Bondi gunmen's month in the Philippines
items.description: The long shadow of the Bondi shooting has also darkened the coastal southern Philippines, causing deep confusion and stoking long-held anxieties over terrorist groups in the region.

items.title: As a building firm collapses, clients want to know 'where the money went'
items.description: Since 2017, Melbourne building boss Mike Harris has overseen four company collapses. Left behind are clients who have lost their life savings and staff who couldn't pay their mortgages.

items.title: Between AI and humanoid robots, we could be at a turning point in history
items.description: What makes the AI-driven stockmarket bubble unique in history is that if it's not a bubble, the impact on humanity could be far more challenging than any previous technology.

items.title: Justice releases Epstein files with Clinton photos, Trump images removed

featured_image.name: US Epstein files full of famous names, but Trump is ...

items.description:
The Justice Department's long-awaited release of investigative files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein on December 19 featured former President Bill Clinton extensively, prompting accusations from his spokesperson that the Trump administration is attempting to deflect attention from the current president's own ties to Epstein[1][2][1].

Multiple never-before-seen photographs show Clinton shirtless in a hot tub with a person whose face is redacted, swimming in a pool with Ghislaine Maxwell, and aboard Epstein's private plane[1][2][1][2]. The files provided little context about when or where the images were taken[3][4][1].

items.title: US boards third tanker near Venezuela as Trump escalates blockade

featured_image.name: U.S. Coast Guard Boards Tanker Carrying Venezuelan Oil

items.description:
The United States has boarded a third oil tanker near Venezuela as President Donald Trump intensifies his pressure campaign against President Nicolás Maduro's government, according to people with knowledge of the matter[1][2]. The Bella 1, a Panamanian-flagged vessel sanctioned by the US, was en route to Venezuela when it was intercepted[1][2].

The boarding follows the Coast Guard's seizure of the Centuries supertanker early Saturday in the Caribbean[3][4][5][6][3], marking the second interdiction in less than two weeks after US forces seized the Skipper tanker on December 10[3][4][5][7][8][9]. Trump declared a "total and complete blockade" of sanctioned oil tankers entering and exiting Venezuela on December 16, designating Maduro's government a foreign terrorist organization[10][11][12][13][14].

items.title: Israel approves 19 West Bank settlements to block Palestinian state

featured_image.name: Israel's Smotrich launches settlement plan to 'bury' idea of Palestinian state

items.description:
Israel's Cabinet on Sunday approved 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank, a decision that will increase the number of settlements by nearly 50% since the current government took office in 2022, according to Peace Now, an anti-settlement watchdog group[1][2][3].

Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich announced the approval and stated explicitly that the move was designed to prevent the establishment of a Palestinian state. "On the ground, we are blocking the establishment of a Palestinian terror state," Smotrich said in a statement[4]. The settlements include two—Ganim and Kadim—that were previously evacuated during Israel's 2005 disengagement plan[4][1][2].

The approval brings the total number of settlements from 141 in 2022 to 210, and increases the number of new settlements approved over the past two years to 69, according to Smotrich[1][2][5]. All Israeli settlements in the occupied West Bank are considered illegal under international law[4][1][2].

items.title: Putin picked Steve Witkoff as Trump’s Ukraine envoy, WSJ says

featured_image.name: Putin Meets With Witkoff and Kushner for Nearly Five Hours

items.description:
Russian President Vladimir Putin personally orchestrated the selection of Steve Witkoff as his preferred American interlocutor, using Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman as an intermediary to engineer the billionaire real estate developer's rise as a key envoy in negotiations over Ukraine, according to a Wall Street Journal report published Friday[1][2][3].

The revelation comes as Russian envoy Kirill Dmitriev arrived in Miami on Saturday for continued peace talks with Witkoff and Jared Kushner, President Donald Trump's son-in-law, marking the latest round of negotiations aimed at ending the nearly four-year war[4][5][6]. Dmitriev told reporters late Saturday that the discussions were proceeding "constructively"[3][6].

items.title: Russia says talks on US peace plan for Ukraine 'are proceeding constructively'
items.description: A Kremlin envoy says peace talks on a U.S.-proposed plan to end the nearly four-year war in Ukraine are proceeding constructively in Florida[2].

items.title: Why the contrast between Chris Minns and the PM has been stark
items.description: As Sydneysiders paid their respects to the Bondi terror victims, one moment captured the contrast between two Labor leaders and their perceived responses to antisemitism.

items.title: Indonesian court sentences an Australian to 12 years in prison for smuggling cocaine to Bali
items.description: Indonesian court sentences an Australian to 12 years in prison for smuggling cocaine to Bali[2].

items.title: At least 9 killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
items.description: Authorities report that nine people have died and at least 10 others are injured after a shooting at a South African pub[2].

items.title: Satellites document year of space breakthroughs and global events
items.description:
From 250 miles above Earth, satellites documented a year marked by both cosmic breakthroughs and terrestrial upheaval, while spacecraft ventured closer to the Sun than ever before and international crews maintained humanity's quarter-century presence in orbit.

High-definition cameras aboard satellites captured 2025's most significant global events with unprecedented clarity, from the Los Angeles wildfires that scorched over 50,000 acres in January to Pope Francis' funeral procession through Vatican City in April[1][2][3]. The European Space Agency's Copernicus Sentinel-2 mission recorded smoke billowing from the Palisades Fire near Santa Monica on January 7, while Landsat satellites revealed burn scars across the greater Los Angeles area through spectral imaging that distinguishes healthy vegetation from charred landscapes[4][5].

items.title: At least 16 Epstein files disappear from DOJ website

featured_image.name: Available to download Friday, some Epstein files no longer there Saturday afternoon

items.description:
At least 16 files disappeared from the U.S. Department of Justice's public webpage for documents related to Jeffrey Epstein less than 24 hours after being posted Friday, with no explanation from the government and no notice to the public, according to reports from the Associated Press and NPR[1][2][3][4].

The missing files, which were accessible Friday and no longer available by Saturday afternoon, included a photograph showing President Donald Trump alongside Epstein, Melania Trump, and Epstein's longtime associate Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as images of artwork depicting nude women[2][5][6]. The photo, labeled file 468, showed a desk drawer containing multiple photographs, with Trump's image among them[7][8].

Democrats on the House Oversight Committee pointed to the missing Trump photograph in a post on X Saturday, writing: "This photo, file 468, from the Epstein files that includes Donald Trump has apparently now been removed from the DOJ release. @AGPamBondi is this true? What else is being covered up? We need transparency for the American public"[1][5][8].

items.title: Ancient interstellar comet emits first-ever radio signal

featured_image.name: You can still see comet 3I/ATLAS in the night sky. Here’s how.

items.description:
An ancient traveler from beyond our solar system completed its closest approach to Earth early Friday morning, as scientists confirmed the first-ever radio signal detection from an interstellar object.

Comet 3I/ATLAS passed within 168 million miles of our planet at approximately 1 a.m. EST on December 19[1][2][3], offering astronomers a rare glimpse of material that may have originated in the thick disk of the Milky Way billions of years before our sun formed[1]. The comet, discovered in July by the Asteroid Terrestrial-impact Last Alert System in Chile[1][4], is only the third confirmed interstellar visitor ever detected, following 'Oumuamua in 2017 and Borisov in 2019[5][6].

items.title: Scientists measure electrical flow in matter hotter than sun

featured_image.name: SLAC researchers measure how materials hotter than the sun's ...

items.description:
Researchers at the Department of Energy's SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory have developed a contactless technique to directly measure electrical conductivity in warm dense matter, an exotic state found deep inside stars and planets, according to a study published in Nature Communications[1][2][3].

The breakthrough, announced by SLAC on December 17, comes after nine years of work and could help scientists better understand planetary magnetic fields and improve nuclear fusion experiments[4][5][6].

items.title: Lula urges EU to finalize Mercosur trade pact in January

featured_image.name: EU delays trade deal with South America’s Mercosur bloc as farmers protest

items.description:
Brazilian President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva on Saturday called on the European Union to demonstrate "courage" and finalize a long-delayed trade agreement with South America's Mercosur bloc, after the deal's signing was postponed to January following fierce opposition from European farmers[1][2][3].

Speaking at a Mercosur summit in Foz do Iguaçu, Brazil, Lula urged EU leaders to move forward with the pact after more than 26 years of negotiations[1][3]. "Without the political will and courage from leaders, it won't be possible to finish a negotiation that has dragged for 26 years," Lula told his South American counterparts, who gathered on the border with Argentina and Paraguay[2][3][4].

European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen had planned to travel to Brazil on December 20 to sign the agreement, but the ceremony was canceled after France and Italy demanded more time to secure stronger protections for their agricultural sectors[1][5][6]. Multiple European diplomatic sources confirmed the signing is now targeted for January 12 in Paraguay[5][7][8].

items.title: Space milestones and Earth monitoring define 2025
items.description:
As 2025 draws to a close, the year stands as a landmark period for spaceflight achievements and humanity's ability to monitor Earth from orbit, with developments ranging from an interstellar visitor's approach this week to quarter-century celebrations of continuous human presence in space.

This Friday, December 19, marks the closest approach of interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS to Earth[1][2][3][4][5], the third known object from beyond our solar system to pass through our cosmic neighborhood. Discovered on July 1 by NASA-funded ATLAS telescopes in Chile[1][4], the seven-mile-wide comet has been tracked by multiple space agencies and observatories, including NASA's Parker Solar Probe, Hubble Space Telescope, and JUICE Jupiter probe[1][2]. The comet will pass approximately 170 million miles from Earth[6][1] before continuing its journey back into interstellar space, never to return.

items.title: Saudi Arabia quietly expands access to its only alcohol store for non-Muslim residents
items.description: Saudi Arabia has quietly expanded access to its only alcohol store, now allowing non-Muslim Premium Residency holders to purchase alcohol legally[2].

items.title: Iraq's political future in limbo as factions vie for power
items.description: Political factions in Iraq have been maneuvering since the parliamentary election more than a month ago to form alliances that will shape the next government[2].

items.title: Australia marks Day of Reflection for Bondi Beach shooting victims
items.description: Australians are lighting candles Sunday to remember the victims of a mass shooting at a Jewish festival in Sydney's Bondi Beach[2].

items.title: US Coast Guard seizes second sanctioned vessel in the Caribbean, officials say
items.description: The U.S. Coast Guard has interdicted a second sanctioned vessel off the coast of Venezuela in international waters of the Caribbean Sea[2].

items.title: Egypt's el-Sissi urges UN Security Council reforms for Africa's larger role
items.description: Egypt’s President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi has called for changes in the U.N. Security Council to give Africa a bigger role in global decisions[2].

items.title: Australian state plans tougher laws against displaying extremist flags after Bondi shooting
items.description: The Australian state of New South Wales is proposing a ban on public displays of Islamic State group flags and extremist symbols[2].

items.title: Pakistani court sentences former PM Imran Khan and wife to 17 years in graft case
items.description: A Pakistani court has convicted former Prime Minister Imran Khan and his wife, Bushra Bibi, sentencing them to 17 years in prison[2].
